The public is able to walk directly up to the goats in the goat barn to pet or feed them. During the inspection, an attendant
was not present at a sufficient frequency to effectively monitor the public's interactions with the goats. A responsible,
knowledgeable, and readily identifiable employee or attendant must be present at all times during periods of public
contact or a barrier must be provided with a sufficient distance between the animals and the public to minimize the risk of
harm to the animals and to the public. Correct by 3/1/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee and facility representatives.
This is a focused inspection to evaluate concerns in a complaint.
